intro: Pilogyne bodinieri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Pilogyne bodinieri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
